intro: Senecio blitoides, commonly known as the blueweed or bluegum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually blue-green in color, with a waxy coating that reduces water loss. Senecio blitoides is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is sometimes used in horticulture for its ornamental value.
